summary: Amino acids are organic compounds that serve as the building blocks of proteins, playing a crucial role in various biochemical processes. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, amino acids are significant in food safety regulations, particularly concerning food additives and nutritional supplements. The European Food Safety Authority (EFSA) evaluates the safety and efficacy of amino acids used in food products, ensuring compliance with the General Food Law Regulation (EC) No 178/2002. Furthermore, amino acids are also relevant in the context of pharmaceuticals, where regulatory bodies assess their therapeutic applications and potential impacts on public health.
